title: Drawing, "Panel with Grotesque Design and Scenes of the Labors of Hercules", ca. 1800
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor on off-white paper, lined with white heavy paper and framed by blue color paper colored light brown and black
markings: watermark:  D C BLAUM and Churchill 194
signed: Signed in pen and brown ink at lower left: C. Normand in. et fecit
provenance: Collection of Leon Decloux (In his collection in 1906. Pendant to -225.)
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Design for a wall panel with a vertical composition.  Episodes from the life of Hercules are interspersed amidst a finely drawn, elaborate display of gardens, urns, nymphs, leafy arbors, pavilions and arabesques.  The panel's representations include, from the bottom up: Hercules and Dejanira; Hercules and Antaeus;  Hercules and Cerverus;  Hercules and the Cretan bull; Hercules and Nemean lion; Hercules carrying the apples of the Hesperides; Hercules killing the Hydra;  Hercules and Geryon (?); Hercules as boy with snake; Mercury advising Hercules.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Panel with Grotesque Design and Scenes of the Labors of Hercules", ca. 1800.
ca. 1800. Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor on off-white paper, lined with white heavy paper and framed by blue color paper colored light brown and black. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-500.
